inclusion.criterion: Clinical, mammographic or ultrasonographic diagnosis of a unicentric carcinoma with an ultrasonographic diameter of equal or less than 2.0 cm.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: for accurate determination of possible multifocality or multicentricity of the tumor, as well as for the determination of possible bone metastasis.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Axillary lymph nodes that cannot be palpated or that are not clinically suspicious for metastasis.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: No previously executed therapy (including biopsy) at any outside institution.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Those patients with nonpalpable lesions will be subjected to preoperative radioactive occult lesion localization (ROLL) or stereotactic biopsy.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Adequate patient information and signature of the informed consent.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Lesions diagnosed as non-infiltrating (in-situ) ductal or lobular carcinoma.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Documented multicentricity and/or abundant multifocality of the neoplasm.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 45-year-old postmenopausal woman with cytologically confirmed breast cancer. Candidate for tumor resection and agrees to do so prior to chemotherapy.
